website_summaries.verdict: Do-it-yourselfers who have small tasks around the house to complete will find this set useful, but others on our list either offer superior quality or more features at better prices.
pros: A durable, portable jig that's easy to adjust to measure different materials and 4 different thickness levels
cons: Though it comes with a case, it's flimsy and may not hold up to extended use
Drill bits have been known to break and not produce "clean" holes

customer_reviews.title: EASILY BROKEN AND CHEAP QUALITY.
customer_reviews.text: This is packaged in a very thin flimsy case that is easily broken. The main part of the jig was warped and difficult to rotate but we are no sure if it was a defect in the product or damage done in shipping as the case was shattered upon arrival and the thin bubble wrap envelope it came in was ripped and showed clear signs of having a much heavier package on top of it. The rest of the components seemed substandard and cheaply made. We were able to find a name brand for $10.00 less at our local big box hardware store with a metal case.
customer_reviews.author: Tarie Allen

customer_reviews.title: Works great! all my years of doing wood working
customer_reviews.text: used this to build a bed, used roughly 2000 screws the first go around with it. Works great! all my years of doing wood working, i cannot believe that i hadn't bought this yet. Great tool for your inventory. cheap but build solid, and changes sizes quickly. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am currently using it as a very nice product It is a comfortable item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tool, I cannot imagain my woodworking life without it. Love it
customer_reviews.author: hanan

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the shop
customer_reviews.text: The whole pocket hole idea is great and this is a solid jig to put the technique to work. Can't imagine that Kreg has anything on this product. I'd give it a 5 except that the case is very flimsy and probably won't last a month.
customer_reviews.author: aahann

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a used product. I don't really think it was but the corner of the case was broken and the hex adjustment tool was missing. Certainly no big deal. All the major components were there and brand new. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: dutch806

customer_reviews.title: The step drill bit does not produce a clean hole ...
customer_reviews.text: The step drill bit does not produce a clean hole. I thought it is because of the hole is located across the grain, but it is the same for holes that are parallel to the grain and also on mdf that has no grain.
customer_reviews.author: Syahill Chik

customer_reviews.title: OK for larger wood. not great for anything smaller than 2X4
customer_reviews.text: I wish it would come with a smaller bit for smaller screws. Other than that it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Abooza69

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Was able to construct a cedar countertop with no problems. This is perfect for the DIY'er, but buy a more quality product if your going to use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Adventure Days

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and thought I might be getting a better product than the Kreg brand. I was severely mistaken. The jig itself is a nice concept, but poorly executed. Too many moving, plastic parts. The piece you have to spin around to catch the edge of the stile does not seat properly and should be made of metal, and is sloppy as well due to the fact that the ridges across the top of the jig don't allow your clamp to stay in place. I do trim and cabinets for a living and would advise you just spend the extra ten bucks and buy the Kreg jig.
customer_reviews.author: C. Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: He's already put it to good use!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this jig. I gave it to him as a Christmas gift. He's already put it to good use !
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine Rumple

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Worked for one hole before the bit tip broke off.
customer_reviews.author: Rena Rippe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Jig Kit
customer_reviews.text: The Wolfcraft 4643 Pocket Hole Jig Kit is an excellent tool for the occasional use of pocket hole joinery. For frequent or professional use, the KREG family of accessories may be easier to use, but for the DIY'er the Wolfcraft kit is useful and economical. I had occasion to use my kit in fabricating a new garage door inside handle when the original plastic one broke. The kit worked fine to secure the two sections of the cruciform together.
customer_reviews.author: J. Crivelli

customer_reviews.title: Not for big jobs.
customer_reviews.text: Look, this item is ok for small jobs. Do yourself a favor - spend the money and get the Kregg Jig with the clamp already included.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Exposure

customer_reviews.title: Great tool with some planning
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy this tool from amazon but I use it quite a bit. The hardest part is ensuring a tight clamp so that it doesn't slip during drilling. Also, keep in mind that while the measurement guides on the jig itself are exact your wood may not be. Usually more common with plywood where 3/4" really isn't 3/4" so you have to "back out" the drill bit so that you're not really setting the collar for 3/4" but a little bit less. Test on scrap and you'll be fine but overall it's a great product especially for smaller spaces where you may have forgotten a pocket hole or for the ease of a smaller tool in your bag.
customer_reviews.author: oswaldo maldonado

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this product to anyone that wants a simple pocket ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product from my local Menards store. It's simpler than the Kreg jig and it has all the measurement required info on the jig instead of a sheet that's hard to follow. I would recommend this product to anyone that wants a simple pocket hole jig that isn't complex to use and comes with everything to start the job after purchasing. Once you set the lock collar on drill bit it doesn't fit back in the case properly.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Perfect birthday peace offering between sister and her husband arguing over unfinished honey-do projects.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for Brother-In-Law in deference to a more expensive brand name that is common here in the US. My sister has a LOT of repairs on a honey-do list for him, and suggested this for his birthday, as it would help him more easily and quickly do these repairs and upgrades all around the house. They both have enjoyed it thus far in helping create a sorely needed bathroom sink cabinet replacement. The current sink basin is being held up by 2 1x2 sticks! I'm hoping by purchasing this, it will squelch some of their often-times LOUD discussions (read here arguments) over his not finishing any of the projects.
customer_reviews.author: Wildfyre

customer_reviews.title: Complete assortment, great jig
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality jig. It's sturdy and robust. I love that so many screws and dowels are included. It's got everything I need to fasten hidden pocket holes. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: No Name

product_meta.title: wolfcraft 4643404 Pocket Hole Woodjoining Jig Kit
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM
The Wolfcraft Pocket Hole Jig Kit features a compact design coupled with durable construction. The jig's one-piece, glass-filled nylon, design means no loose parts, and the preset depths take the guesswork out of drilling. Its small size allows it to fit easily into a small toolbox or pouch, and also lets you work in small or difficult to reach places. Additionally, all the screws are self-tapping and are combination Phillips/Square drives.

 What's in the Box
Pocket hole jig, 3/8-inch step drill, ten 1-inch screws, ten 1-1/4-inch screws, ten 1-1/2-inch screws, ten 2-1/2-inch screws, 1/8-inch hex key, 3/8-inch stop collar, 10 wooden pocket hole plugs, and a #2 square drive screwdriver bit.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Wolfcraft Pocket Hole Jig Kit contains 1 pocket hole jig, 1 3/8-inch step drill, 10 1-inch screws, 10 1-1/4-inch screws, 10 1-1/2-inch screws, 10 2-1/2-inch screws, 1/8-inch hex key, 3/8-inch stop collar, 10 wooden pocket hole plugs, and a no. 2 square drive screwdriver bit. Please note all screws are self-tapping and combination Phillips/Square Drive.
feature_bullets: Pocket hole jig kit features a compact design coupled with durable construction
Small size allows it to fit easily into a small toolbox or pouch, as well as work in small or difficult to reach places
One-piece, glass-filled nylon, design means no loose parts
Preset depths take the guesswork out of drilling
All the screws are self-tapping and are combination Phillips/Square Drive
